name: euphonic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal having a pleasant sound: We could hear the rich, euphonic voices of the choir. He uses euphonic sounds in his poetry to create a pleasing effect. Synonym
euphonious
language
  specialized (of a speech sound in some languages) changed to make it easier to pronounce: The initial sound is simply euphonic. These usages of the euphonic letters are explained below.
More examplesFewer examplesMany of the most euphonic words in English are borrowed from Italian.It’s a lovely word that has a fine euphonic rhythm.This piece of music has delighted listeners with its melodious and euphonic sound for many years.The use of this sound is wholly euphonic.
